byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden reported from Paris, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and ISABEL KERSHNER

abstract: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization adopts resolution criticizing Israel for its poor management of Jerusalem heritage sites; resolution, which condemns Israel for violating freedom of worship, resulted from violent clashes between Israelis and Palestinians at Al Aqsa compound, holy site for both Jews and Muslims; resolution stops short of classifying Western Wall, one of Judaism’s holiest sites, as part of Al Aqsa Mosque compound in Old City.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ cultural heritage agency did omit a plan to classify the Western Wall as part of the Al Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem.

headline.main: Unesco Resolution Criticizes Israel Over Handling of Holy Sites
headline.print_headline: Unesco Criticizes Israel Over Handling of Holy Sites

snippet: The United Nations’ cultural heritage agency did omit a plan to classify the Western Wall as part of the Al Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem.

keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
